configuration_parameters.name: auto_increment_increment
configuration_parameters.description: auto_increment_increment and auto_increment_offset are intended for use with master-to-master replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

configuration_parameters.name: auto_increment_offset
configuration_parameters.description: auto_increment_increment and auto_increment_offset are intended for use with master-to-master replication, and can be used to control the operation of AUTO_INCREMENT columns.

configuration_parameters.name: back_log
configuration_parameters.description: The number of outstanding connection requests MySQL can have. This comes into play when the main MySQL thread gets very many connection requests in a very short time. It then takes some time (although very little) for the main thread to check the connection and start a new thread. The back_log value indicates how many requests can be stacked during this short time before MySQL momentarily stops answering new requests. The default value depends on system architecture.
